go_data.justification: TRAF1 is required for the recruitment of members of the cellular inhibitor of apoptosis protein (c-IAP) family to the TNFR2-signaling complex.
TRAF1 may work as an adapter protein to recruit different downstream signal transducers to the receptor complex.
TRAF1 interacts with TRIP in the cytoplasm.
TRAF1 forms a complex with TRAF2 and TRIP.

go_data.term: negative regulation of NF-kappaB transcription factor activity
go_data.justification: TRAF1 interacts with A20, which inhibits NF-kappaB activation.
